title: Have you heard that the Metropolitan Opera is streaming operas for free? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yep. I think it’s once a week online, in addition to the weekly Saturday radio broadcasts. You can also subscribe too their “On Demand” library and watch their library of recorded performances, both audio and video if available. In fact, they just recently added a performance of Don Giovanni from 1978, with (get this cast) James, Morris, Gabriel Bacquier, Joan Sutherland, Julia Varady, Allan Monk, John MacCurdy and I forget who the other two are. It’s their old production with sets and costumes designed by Eugene Berman, traditional, colorful, with a very young James Morris in the title role. And treats the story with respect, no modernized nonsense, no gratuitous sex scenes, no Nazi uniforms, and a statue that actually walks and talks (or sings), and shakes hands with Giovanni, up close and personal. Now if only they would put up a Faust that is just as good. And why in the world did nobody think to make a video of Turandot with Corelli and Nilsson?
Yes. Go on to metopera.org and they will give you a schedule
You can add Met on Demand streaming to your Roku, if you have it. I didn’t look into further possibilities because I do.:)
YES, AND IN VIEW OF THE CURRENT PANDEMIC PROBLEM OTHER THEATRE AND ENTERTAINMENT ORGANIZATIONS ARE DOING LIKE WISE. r.m.
